name: Golden Wheat
description: Staple grain for bread, porridge, and army rations.

name: Rye Bushels
description: Hardy grain that thrives in poor, rocky soil.

name: Barley Sheaves
description: Versatile grain for stews, feed, and cheap ale.

name: Sturdy Potatoes
description: Reliable root crop that keeps through long winters.

name: Cabbage Heads
description: Unfashionable but durable greens for common tables.

name: Sunberries
description: Sweet berries that lift morale in lean seasons.

name: Nightfigs
description: Dark, rich fruit favored by nobles and smugglers.

name: Emberpepper Spice
description: Fiery spice that turns bland stews into feasts.

name: Star Anise Seeds
description: Fragrant seeds prized by chefs and apothecaries.

name: Salted Beef
description: Preserved meat, ideal for garrisons and expeditions.

name: Smoked Game
description: Smoked venison and boar for officers and festivals.

name: Emperor's Table Feast
description: A legendary spread of delicacies that can sway entire courts.
